intro: Eltroplectris schlechteriana, commonly known as the Schlechter's eltroplectris, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Orchidaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly in countries like Brazil and Colombia. The plant is characterized by its small, intricate flowers that typically feature a distinctive coloration pattern. It thrives in shaded, humid environments, often found in forest understories. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its natural range.
